data.title: Timeline
data.meta_description: 1971 October Grex Vocalis is founded with 12 singers 1972 March Music Evening in Fagerborg Church, Oslo April Renaissance, early baroque with Schola Instrumentalis at Høvikodden, Bærum, Norway 1973…
data.text:
1971

October

Grex Vocalis is founded with 12 singers

1972

March

Music Evening in Fagerborg Church, Oslo

April

Renaissance, early baroque with Schola Instrumentalis at Høvikodden, Bærum, Norway

1973

August

November

Medieval, Renaissance, romantic and contemporary music in Gamle Aker Church, Oslo

1974

February

Recording in Ris Church in Oslo for NRK Radio (The Norwegian Broadcasting Corporation), two programs

March

Poulenc: Easter Motets, Høvikodden, Bærum, Norway

April

Festival in Loreto, Italy

November

Bach: Cantata 140 with Canticum Novum Chamber Orchestra in Uranienborg Church, Oslo

1975

June

August

Munch Museum in Oslo: Norwegian folk songs, Hindemith, Poulenc

September

Festival in Barcelona, Spain

November

Uranienborg Church in Oslo: Renaissance, early baroque, romantic, neoclassical

1976

January

The Trinity Church, Oslo: Tallis: Spem in alium with other choirs from Oslo

May

Bergen International Festival, Bergen, Norway: Madrigals, Norwegian folk songs, Mørk Karlsen, Jacobsen, Kverno, Poulenc

October

1977

March

Poulenc: Mass in G major for NRK Television

August

1978

May

Festival in Warsaw, Poland: Renaissance, folk songs, contemporary, Scandinavian

September

Høvikodden, Bærum, Norway: Kagel’s Ex-position (premiere)

November

Nordberg Church, Oslo: Poulenc, Larsson, Brahms

Institut de Recherche et Coordination Acoustique/Musique, (IRCAM) Paris, France: Kagels Ex-position

1979

June

Festival in Fano, Italy: Renaissance, Milhaud, Larsson.

Concerts in Venezia and Sirolo, Italy.

September

University of Oslo Auditorium: Brahms: Liebeslieder

Hot Theater, The Haag, Netherlands: Kagels Ex-position

1980

June

Hamburg, West Germany: Verdi: Requiem

July

Concert in Nidaros Cathedral, Trondheim, Norway during the St. Olav Festival; Purcell, Brahms, Poulenc, Grieg, Larsson

1981

March/April

Lasso, Poulenc, Kverno, Kagel – Eidsvold, Norway, The Trinity Church, Oslo and Oscarskyrkan, Stockholm, Sweden

April

Sami Dies Irae in Oslo Concert Hall with the Norwegian Soloist Choir and Nordstrand Church Choir

June

Gala Concert in Oslo Concert Hall for Norway’s Meat and Pork Association: Folk music

November

University of Oslo AuditoriumUniversity of Oslo Auditorium: 10th Anniversary Concert: Brahms, Poulenc, Germeten, Monteverdi

Festival in Athens and Corinth, Greece

1982

April/August

Recording by NRK Television: Passion in the Arts, Nature, Love and Brahms: Liebeslieder

August

Gorizia, Italy: Choir Competition. 1st prize for mixed choirs, 2nd prize for folk songs and a prize for the best performance of a contemporary piece

October

Høvikodden, Bærum, Norway: Per Nørgård: Dance in the Early Spring

1983

March

Oslo Cathedral: Handel, Purcell, Bach, Vivaldi, and Palestrina with Paul Esswood and Oslo Consort

September

Venezia, Milano, Cuneo, Italy: Concert tour

1984

August

Festival in Montepulciano, Italy: Arne Nordheim: Aurora, Britten: War Requiem

October

Oslo Cathedral: Brahms: A German Requiem with Oslo Cathedral Choir and Oslo Philharmonic Orchestra

November

Hamburg, Germany: Norwegian Music Week, contemporary Norwegian music, Nordheim: Aurora

1985

February

Oslo Cathedral: Recording for NRK Television: Handel: Dixit Dominus. Conductor: Mark Deller

May

Bergen International Festival, Concerts in Håkon’s Hall and Troldhaugen

1986

June

Wye, England: Purcell: Fairy Queen, Nordheim, Grieg, Kverno, Bergh. Conductors: Carl Høgset and Mark Deller

September

Oslo Concert Hall: Two concerts and recording: Oddvar S. Kvam: Querela Pacis

November

1987

April

Oslo Cathedral: Penderecki: St. Luke Passion with Oslo Cathedral Choir, Sølvguttene, Oslo Philharmonic Orchestra. Conductor: Krzysztof Penderecki

June

NRK Television: German hits with Arja Saijonmaa

September

The Basque Country, Spain: Festival, La Semaña Chorale. Concert in Hondarribia

November

The Trinity Church, Oslo: Terje Rypdal’s Ineo, with Terje Rypdal, conductor Christian Eggen, string orchestra

1988

May

Kampen Church, Oslo: Concert: The Banners of Freedom Anew

July

Festival in Fano, Italy

November

Oslo Cathedral: Verdi: Quattro Pezzi Sacri with Oslo Cathedral Choir, Oslo Philharmonic Orchestra. Conductor: John Nelson

1989

March

Festival in Joensuu, Finland: Arne Nordheim: Aurora

June

Festival in Tampere, Finland: Arne Nordheim: Aurora

September

Festival in Porto Torres, Sardinia, Italy

1990

January

The Trinity Church, Oslo: Britten: Hymn to St. Cecilia, Verdi, Purcell/Sandström, Kverno, Bergh

May

Bordesholm, ltzehoe and Kiel, Germany. Carl Orff: Carmina Burana and selected repertoire

June

Festival in Leningrad/Novgorod, Russia

October

Oslo Cathedral: Serge Lancen’s Missa Solemnis with Sagene Janitsjar

1991

February

University of Oslo Auditorium: Carl Orff: Carmina Burana, Brahms: Five Songs with Jubal, Grete Helgerød

June

Northern Norway Festival: Arne Nordheim: Aurora, concerts with Jan Garbarek

October

Nidaros Cathedral, Trondheim, Norway: Nordlyd Festival: Nordheim, Palestrina, Brahms, Purcell/Sandström

November

1992

April

Concert at Tingvang in Øystre Slidre, Norway

October

Participation in the International Choir Competition in Tolosa, Spain. 1st prize

1993

March

University of Oslo Auditorium: Venezia 1613. Monteverdi

May/June

Marktoberdorf, participation in a chamber choir competition. 1st prize for mixed choirs

December

University of Oslo Auditorium: Grex and Jan Garbarek

1994

January/March

Arne Nordheim: Draumkvedet at The Norwegian Theater. Director: Bentein Baardson. Conductor: Ingar Bergby. 40 performances in total

May

Fulda, Germany: Guest performance at the 4th national choir competition in Germany

Corale in Legnano, Italy. Three concerts during the festival

June

Japan: Concerts in Nagano and Tokyo

1995

February

Oslo Cathedral: Le Baroque Français

July

European Choir Symposium in Ljubljana, Slovenia. Joint concert: Penderecki’s St. Luke Passion

October

Fagerborg Church: 400 Years of Church Music

December

La Laguna, Tenerife, Spain: Participation in the festival Encuentro Coral

1996

September

Le Baroque Français sacré, Frogner Church, Oslo

December

Handel: Messiah, Ris Church. The concert was broadcast on NRK Television and a CD recording was released by the record company Quattro AS.

1997

February

July

Festival in Namur, Belgium on the occasion of IFCM’s 15th anniversary. Concerts in H. Hartkerk, Knokke, Belgium Salines Royales de Dieuze, and a mass in Brussels Cathedral

1998

May

Festival in Szczecin, Poland. A church concert and a concert in the Philharmonic Concert Hall

November

Handel: Messiah in The Trinity Church, Oslo, two concerts

1999

January

University of Oslo Auditorium: Poulenc Concert on the 100th anniversary of the composer’s birthday

August

Arezzo, Italy: Choir Competition. 1st prize for mixed choirs and winner of Il Gran Premio Città d´Arezzo

Concerts in Aquasparta and Pescosolido, Italy

Sept/Oct

Poulenc’s: Figure Humaine. Concerts in Larvik, Sarpsborg, Hoff Church, Hamar and Gol, Norway

October

University of Oslo Auditorium: Petrarca Meets Rypdal

December

Bach: Christmas Oratorio in The Trinity Church, Oslo. Two concerts. Recording for NRK Television

2000

April

Arne Nordheim: Nidaros Oratorio in The Trinity Church, Oslo. Two concerts. Conductor: Manfred Honeck

June

Tolosa, Spain: Participant in Grand Prix Européen du Chant Coral. Concerts in Ordizia, Zarauz and Tolosa, Spain

December

Handel: Messiah in Uranienborg Church, Oslo

2001

April

Gamle Aker Church: EBU Concert. Conductor: Tone Bianca Dahl. Participants: Nils Økland, Hardanger fiddle

June/July

Vestfold Festival: Arne Nordheim 70 years. Concerts in Larvik Church and Slagen Church, Tønsberg

September

Festival in Sardinia: Voci di Europa. Concerts in Porto Torres and Cagliari

November

University of Oslo Auditorium: 30th Anniversary Concert. Lasso, Poulenc, Verdi, Groven and Nordheim

2002

March

Poulenc: Stabat Mater during the Oslo Church Music Festival in The Trinity Church, Oslo

December

Uranienborg Church, Oslo: French Christmas. Charpentier: Messe de Minuit and Rameau: In Convertendo

2003

October

Concert in Boxgrove Priory, Chichester, England. Final in Let the Peoples Sing in Queen Elizabeth Hall, London, England

December

Uranienborg Church, Oslo: Magnum Mysterium. A cappella concert

2004

March

University of Oslo Auditorium: La Musica Cubana. Conductor: Digna Guerra Ramirez

October

Concerts in Vestervig and Herning, Denmark

December

Monteverdi: Marian Vespers in The Trinity Church, Oslo. Recording for NRK P2

2005

March

Oslo Cathedral: Ludvig Irgens Jensen’s Heimferd during the Oslo Church Music Festival

April

University of Oslo Auditorium: Sakura. A Japanese-Norwegian experience. Conductors: Fumiaki Kuriyama and Carl Høgset

July

Japan: Concerts in Sapporo, Matsumoto, Nirasaki, Utsonomiya and Tokyo, Japan

September

November

Barocco Mexicano in Uranienborg Church, Oslo.

2006

May/June

Festival in Szczecin, Poland. Concerts in Prenslau, Germany, Szczecin and Kamien Pomorski, Poland

September

Arne Nordheim’s: Draumkvedet in The Trinity Church, Oslo

November

December

Handel: Messiah in Uranienborg Church, Oslo.

2007

March/April

Participation in America Cantat, Havana, Cuba.

October

Bologna, Italy: Instrument in a competition for conductors. Concerts in Sala Bolognese and the City Hall of Bologna

December

Christmas Concert: Magnum Mysterium in Uranienborg Church, Oslo

2008

May

In meinem Himmel, in meinem Lied, a cappella concert in Uranienborg Church, Oslo

September

Festival in Olbia, Sardinia, Italy

November

Bach: Mass in B minor in Uranienborg Church, Oslo.

December

Participants in the closing concert of Stavanger European Capital of Culture

2009

March

Hear My Prayer, Concert of baroque music in Uranienborg Church, Oslo

May

Concerts in Wuppertal-Barmen, Münster, Meggen and Cologne Cathedral, Germany

November

Brahms: A German Requiem. Version for four-handed piano. Uranienborg Church, Oslo

2010

April

Bach: Magnificat and Handel: Coronation Anthems. Uranienborg Church, Oslo

May

Concerts in Østre Porsgrunn Church and Skien Church with Canto Ammonia, Skien, Norway

September

Invitation to Arezzo, Italy, to receive the Guidoneum Award. Concerts in Arezzo, Orvieto and Roma, Italy

November

Bach: Mass in B minor in Uranienborg Church, Oslo.

2011

June

Participation in Internationale Chorbiennale Aachen, Germany. Concerts in Monschau and Aachen, Germany

Joint concert: Britten’s War Requiem in Eurogress, Aachen. Conductor: Klaus Arp

September

University of Oslo Auditorium: 40th Anniversary concert: Gabrieli, Tallis, Nystedt, Grieg, Brahms, Nordheim

December

Mozart: Mass in C minor. Oslo Cathedral.

Asker Culture Center: Magnum Mysterium

2012

April

University of Oslo Auditorium: Spring Concert with the The Norwegian Student Choral Society

July

November

Closing concert of the Røa Music Festival, Oslo

December

Bach: Christmas Oratorio with Barokkanerne in Uranienborg Church, Oslo.

2013

April

Mozart: Requiem with Barokkanerne in the University of Oslo Auditorium.
